reactor.fn

Class Suppliers

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.fn.Suppliers

  • public abstract class Suppliers
extends Object
    Helper class for working tying Suppliers to Iterables and other types of collections.
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Supplier<T> collect(List<Supplier<T>> suppliers)
      Create a Supplier that aggregates the given list of suppliers by calling each one, in turn, until the supplier returns null.
      static <T> Supplier<T> drain(Iterable<T> c)
      Create a Supplier which drains the contents of the given Iterable by internally creating an Iterator and delegating each call of Supplier.get() to Iterator.next().
      static <T> Supplier<T> drainAll(Iterable<Iterable<T>> iters)
      Create a Supplier which drains all of the given Iterables.
      static <T> Supplier<T> filter(Iterable<T> src, Predicate<T> predicate)
      Filter the given Iterable using the given Predicate so that calls to the return Supplier.get() will provide only items from the original collection which pass the predicate test.
      static <T> Supplier<T> roundRobin(T... objs)
      Create a Supplier that continually round-robin load balances each call to Supplier.get() by iterating over the objects.
      static <T> Supplier<T> supply(T obj)
      Wrap the given object that will supply the given object every time Supplier.get() is called.
      static <T> Supplier<T> supplyOnce(T obj)
      Supply the given object only once, the first time Supplier.get() is invoked.
      static <T> Supplier<T> supplyWhile(T obj, Predicate<T> predicate)
      Supply the given object to callers only as long as the given Predicate returns true.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static <T> Supplier<T> supply(T obj)
        Wrap the given object that will supply the given object every time Supplier.get() is called.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the supplied object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to supply
        Returns:
        the new Supplier

      • supplyOnce

        public static <T> Supplier<T> supplyOnce(T obj)
        Supply the given object only once, the first time Supplier.get() is invoked.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the supplied object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to supply
        Returns:
        the new Supplier

      • supplyWhile

        public static <T> Supplier<T> supplyWhile(T obj,
                                          Predicate<T> predicate)
        Supply the given object to callers only as long as the given Predicate returns true.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the supplied object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to supply
        predicate - the predicate to check to determine whether or not to supply the given value
        Returns:
        the new Supplier

      • roundRobin

        public static <T> Supplier<T> roundRobin(T... objs)
        Create a Supplier that continually round-robin load balances each call to Supplier.get() by iterating over the objects. When the end is reached, it wraps around to the first object and keeps providing objects to callers.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the supplied object
        Parameters:
        objs - the objects to load-balance
        Returns:
        the new Supplier

      • filter

        public static <T> Supplier<T> filter(Iterable<T> src,
                                     Predicate<T> predicate)
        Filter the given Iterable using the given Predicate so that calls to the return Supplier.get() will provide only items from the original collection which pass the predicate test.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the source
        Parameters:
        src - the source of objects to filter
        predicate - the Predicate to test items against
        Returns:
        the new Supplier

      • drain

        public static <T> Supplier<T> drain(Iterable<T> c)
        Create a Supplier which drains the contents of the given Iterable by internally creating an Iterator and delegating each call of Supplier.get() to Iterator.next().
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the source
        Parameters:
        c - the collection to consume
        Returns:
        the new Supplier

      • drainAll

        public static <T> Supplier<T> drainAll(Iterable<Iterable<T>> iters)
        Create a Supplier which drains all of the given Iterables.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the source
        Parameters:
        iters - the collections to consume
        Returns:
        the new Supplier
        See Also:
        drain(Iterable)

      • collect

        public static <T> Supplier<T> collect(List<Supplier<T>> suppliers)
        Create a Supplier that aggregates the given list of suppliers by calling each one, in turn, until the supplier returns null. The aggregator then goes on to the next supplier in the list and delegates calls to that supplier, and so on, until the end of the list is reached.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the source
        Parameters:
        suppliers - the list of suppliers to delegate to
        Returns:
        the new Supplier
